remarks: The predicate "is a Hilbert lattice".  Here we replace ` K e. CvLat ` with the weaker ` K e. AtLat ` and show the exchange property explicitly.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2012.)
statement:
ishlat.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
ishlat.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
ishlat.s $e |- .< = ( lt ` K ) $.
ishlat.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
ishlat.z $e |- .0. = ( 0. ` K ) $.
ishlat.u $e |- .1. = ( 1. ` K ) $.
ishlat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
ishlat2 $p |- ( K e. HL <-> ( ( K e. OML /\ K e. CLat /\ K e. AtLat ) /\ ( A. x e. A A. y e. A ( ( x =/= y -> E. z e. A ( z =/= x /\ z =/= y /\ z .<_ ( x .\/ y ) ) ) /\ A. z e. B ( ( -. x .<_ z /\ x .<_ ( z .\/ y ) ) -> y .<_ ( z .\/ x ) ) ) /\ E. x e. B E. y e. B E. z e. B ( ( .0. .< x /\ x .< y ) /\ ( y .< z /\ z .< .1. ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d K x y z $.
